citation.article-title: Maribaculum marinum gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from deep seawater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Maribaculum (Ma.ri.ba′cu.lum. L. neut. n. mare the sea; L. neut. n. baculum a stick or rod; N.L. neut. n. Maribaculum rod from the sea).
Cells are Gram-negative-staining, short rods or ovoid, non-motile, non-budding and non-prostheca-producing, oxidase-negative and catalase-positive.
Flagella and holdfasts are not present.
Carotenoid, bacteriochlorophyll a and the genes for anoxygenic photosynthesis (pufLM) are not found.
The dominant fatty acids are C16 : 0 and C18 : 1ω7c.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 61.0 mol%.
The genus is assigned phylogenetically to the family Hyphomonadaceae in the order Rhodobacterales.
The type species is Maribaculum marinum.
